mendel.event

Class EventMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • mendel.event.EventMap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MendelEventMap

    public class EventMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a base implementation for mapping event identifiers to classes, and classes back to event identifiers.
    Author:
    malensek

    • Method Detail

      • addMapping

        protected void addMapping(int id,
              java.lang.Class<? extends Event> clazz)
        Maps an event identifier to a particular Event class implementation.
        Parameters:
        id - Event Identifier
        clazz - Class to map to id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event id provided has already been mapped to an Event implementation.

      • addMapping

        protected void addMapping(java.lang.Class<? extends Event> clazz)
        Maps an Event class implementation to an automatically-generated event identifier. This method is useful for applications with a small number of events whose identifiers can change over time, but should generally not be used in production settings.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class to map to id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event id provided has already been mapped to an Event implementation.

      • getClass

        public java.lang.Class<? extends Event> getClass(int id)
        Retrieves the class associated with the provided event identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - Event identifier to retrieve an Event implementation for.

      • getInt

        public int getInt(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Retrieves the event identifier associated with a given Event class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to retrieve the event identifier for.
